Religious visits
Top Kashmir Tour Packages from Mumbai: Your Ultimate Guide
By Kashmir Online
Sep 18, 2024
4 min read

Imagine leaving behind the hustle and bustle of Mumbai for the serene landscapes of Kashmir, where nature and peace reign supreme. Booking one of the Kashmir tour packages from Mumbai is your ticket to experiencing the breathtaking beauty of the region, filled with majestic mountains, pristine lakes, and lush green valleys.

In this guide, we’ll take you through the top tourist points to explore, travel options, and helpful tips to ensure your Kashmir adventure is a memorable one.

Why You Should Visit Kashmir on Your Next Vacation

Kashmir offers an escape from the heat and rush of city life. For Mumbaikars, the cool climate, natural beauty, and tranquil atmosphere of Kashmir provide the perfect backdrop for relaxation or adventure. Whether you’re planning a trip with family, friends, or solo, Kashmir tour packages from Mumbai take care of all the details—flights, accommodations, transfers, and sightseeing—so you can focus solely on enjoying your vacation.

Opting for a tour package allows you to fully immerse yourself in the experience, with professional guides and drivers ensuring you get the best out of every location.

Top Tourist Points Covered in Kashmir Tour Packages from Mumbai

Your Kashmir tour package will take you to some of the most captivating tourist spots in the region. These attractions give visitors an opportunity to experience the natural beauty, culture, and history of Kashmir.

1. Dal Lake: Kashmir’s Shimmering Gem

When thinking of Kashmir, the first image that often comes to mind is Dal Lake. Famous for its serene waters, houseboats, and floating gardens, Dal Lake is the crown jewel of Kashmir tourism. A Shikara ride on Dal Lake offers a peaceful escape, allowing you to witness the traditional life on the water.

Whether it’s early morning or during sunset, the beauty of the lake remains timeless. Many Kashmir tour packages for families with flight include a stay on a houseboat, giving you the unique experience of sleeping on water while gazing at the surrounding mountains.

2. Mughal Gardens: A Walk Through History

The Mughal Gardens of Kashmir are a testament to the grandeur of the Mughal era. Nishat Bagh and Shalimar Bagh are two of the most famous Mughal gardens, offering well-manicured lawns, flowing fountains, and stunning views of the surrounding landscapes.

These gardens, built along Dal Lake, provide a peaceful atmosphere where you can take leisurely strolls, admire the flowers, and enjoy the fresh mountain air. Most J&K tourism packages include visits to these gardens, ensuring you get a taste of Kashmir’s rich history and culture.

3. Gondola Ride: Soaring Above the Peaks

One of the most thrilling experiences you can have in Kashmir is riding the Gondola lift, one of the highest cable cars in the world. Offering panoramic views of the snow-covered peaks, the Gondola ride takes you to an elevation where you can marvel at nature’s grandeur.

Adventure seekers will love the skiing and snowboarding opportunities that await at the higher altitudes. Even during summer, the cool air and breathtaking views make this a must-do on your Kashmir trip package. Perfect for families or solo travelers looking for a memorable adventure, the Gondola ride is often included in Kashmir tour packages for family with flight.

4. Betaab Valley: A Filmmaker’s Paradise

Named after the Bollywood film Betaab, this valley is a picturesque destination that has attracted tourists and filmmakers alike. Surrounded by snow-capped mountains, dense forests, and clear streams, Betaab Valley is the perfect spot for picnics and relaxation. It’s also a favorite for photographers who wish to capture Kashmir’s stunning natural beauty.

Betaab Valley is often included in Kashmir tour packages for those looking to explore more offbeat, tranquil locations. Whether you’re hiking through the trails or simply sitting by the riverside, this valley’s beauty will leave you in awe.

5. Shankaracharya Temple: A Spiritual Retreat

For those who wish to add a touch of spirituality to their Kashmir trip, the Shankaracharya Temple, perched on a hilltop, offers not only religious significance but also panoramic views of the valley below. Dedicated to Lord Shiva, this temple is one of the oldest in the region and holds immense cultural importance.

The trek to the temple is a pleasant one, offering glimpses of Kashmir’s landscapes along the way. Many J&K tourism packages include this temple visit, as it gives travelers a spiritual perspective of Kashmir’s cultural diversity.

Best Time to Book Kashmir Tour Packages from Mumbai

Knowing the right time to visit Kashmir is key to maximizing your experience. Each season offers a different side of Kashmir, making every visit unique.

1. Spring and Summer (March to June)

If you’re looking for clear skies and blooming flowers, spring and summer are ideal times to visit. This season brings the Mughal Gardens and Dal Lake to life with vibrant colors and pleasant weather. Kashmir tour packages for families with flights often sell out quickly during these months, as it’s the perfect time for sightseeing, boating, and outdoor activities.

2. Winter (October to February)

For those dreaming of snow-covered landscapes and winter sports, winter is the season to visit. Many Kashmir trip packages cater to skiing enthusiasts, offering direct access to the region’s best slopes. Even if you’re not into skiing, the snowy vistas and cozy houseboat stays create a magical winter wonderland that’s hard to resist.

How to Reach Kashmir from Mumbai

For travelers from Mumbai, reaching Kashmir is easy and convenient, thanks to frequent flight options and well-organized tour packages.

1. Flights from Mumbai to Kashmir

The most convenient way to travel to Kashmir from Mumbai is by air. Direct flights from Mumbai to Srinagar take approximately 2.5 hours. Most Kashmir tour packages from Mumbai include flights, ensuring you have a seamless travel experience. Upon landing at Srinagar Airport, your tour operator will handle your transportation to the hotel or houseboat.

2. Road and Train Options

If you prefer a more scenic and economical option, you can take a train from Mumbai to Jammu Tawi and then continue the journey by road. The drive from Jammu to Srinagar is filled with breathtaking views of valleys, rivers, and mountain ranges, making the long journey worthwhile. Some J&K tourism packages offer this option for those who want to experience a leisurely, picturesque trip to Kashmir.

Important Travel Tips for Your Kashmir Trip

  1. Pack Wisely
    Depending on the season, pack accordingly. For winter travel, bring heavy woolens, snow boots, and thermals. In summer, pack light clothing but also bring layers for the cool evenings.
  2. Stay Hydrated
    The high altitudes of Kashmir can cause mild altitude sickness, so make sure to stay hydrated and pace yourself when exploring.
  3. Respect Local Customs
    Kashmir has a rich cultural heritage, and it’s important to respect local traditions, especially when visiting religious sites. Dress modestly and follow local customs to make your experience more enriching.
  4. Carry Cash
    Although you’ll find ATMs in cities like Srinagar, smaller towns like Pahalgam and Sonamarg may have limited ATM access. It’s wise to carry cash for smaller expenses and local purchases.

Whether you’re seeking adventure or peace, Kashmir tour packages from Mumbai offer a variety of experiences for every type of traveler. With so many breathtaking tourist points to explore, from the serenity of Dal Lake to the grandeur of the Gondola ride, Kashmir promises a trip full of unforgettable memories.

Book your Kashmir trip package today with Kashmir Online and embark on the journey of a lifetime!
